channel.title: Thoughts on Jayesh Nair
channel.description: Recent content in Thoughts on Jayesh Nair

item.title: An Ode to the Internet
item.description:
I.

On August 15, 1995, Indians woke up to the tariff plan of a new sort of communication service. They could buy dial-up internet.

At Rs 15,000 a year, it was not quite something the average Indian could afford then.

I was still a young kid when I had a glimpse of the Internet1. The old dial-up connection tones, the slow speeds and hefty charges levied. But I was part of the generation that grew up with itâ€™s evolving use cases. From simple search back then to entire generations who experience banking online and now even - digital factories.
